description:
About The Role

Media Monks Data Consulting team is seeks an Enterprise Consultant specializing in Insights on our Amazon team to support paid media initiatives across Prime, Retail, and Brand big rocks. This position will be responsible for providing insights and actionable recommendations to improve paid media effectiveness, utilizing Amazon internal and 3rd Party data. In addition, you will analyze media campaign performance, marketing investment, and provide strategic recommendations to the Media team.

Responsibilities


  • Work in conjunction with Paid Media team and Client Activation teams to analyze cross-channel campaign tactics (Digital and Traditional) and provide optimizations and recommendations
  • Oversee development of analytical plans including proper selection of methodologies, techniques, KPIs and metrics
  • Partner with Product teams and Client Data Operations teams to generate insightful visualizations and dashboards to depict trends in data, inform recommendations, develop benchmarks, etc.
  • Partner with media agency Analytics team to align on analytics roadmap, KPIs, and ensure consistent information exchange
  • Serve as thought leader internally, writing POV’s on industry trends and new technologies in the analytics area
  • Assist Client Data Operations team with any operational needs such as raw data compilation and synthesis, data esports and QA, tagging and trafficking, etc.


Media Analytics & Measurement Thought Leadership


  • Develop mental models on media measurement and define success metrics across Big Rocks and the funnel, identifying how, when, why we leverage different metrics and tools across campaigns
  • Seek opportunities to further measurement capabilities (3P and internal), addressing gaps in data sets with partnership teams
  • Build and maintain learning agenda and measurement plan and partner with MODE activation on an experiment/testing roadmap
  • Help drive measurement tool/product roadmap and innovation in partnership with MODE product/RAFT, assisting with recommendations to enhance dashboard and insights on behalf of cross-channel media team
  • Liaison with CMO and Portfolio on specific media needs and requirements on behalf of cross-channel media team


Campaign Reporting


  • Develop and own a template for bi-weekly leadership executive summary (mid funnel) and post campaign template (HVEs, Big Bet) across all live campaigns
  • Bi-weekly Mid Funnel Reporting (Prime and Brand/Retail mid funnel campaigns) for MODE and ADA managed. Includes deep dive analysis, condensing into narrative format and distilling further into executive summary for leadership.
  • Big Bet/HVE campaign post campaign reporting and executive summary for leadership across MODE, ADA, and Rufus
  • Gather and collect data to input into CBR in partnership with media managers


Premium Video Reporting & Optimization Management


  • Develop and maintain optimization mechanism to allow for more frequent (during Options and in-campaign) and more granular (partner level) optimizations to our premium video buy across Upfront and Scatter, leveraging all data available to us (ACE, Attention, Brand, D+M, etc.)
  • Establish tracker and mechanisms for 1000bps waste reduction in frequency for TV + POLV
  • Pull past year of data in refreshed sample from Data + Math for 2023-Q1 2024 to see how we’re performing quarterly, by campaign against our frequency across demographics
  • Elevate observations at publisher level and report monthly a summary for tracking and optimization purposes


Attention Tracking & Management


  • Pull post campaign impressions for MODE digital and Social from Adelaide for assessing AU level impressions.
  • Compare digital Adelaide and DoubleVerify for Q1-Q3 campaigns.
  • Manage pre-campaign estimates of aCPM calculation with data leveraging post campaign reports and forecasting new campaign based on planned CPM
  • Ongoing recommendations for optimization to track against aCPM improvement by 500bps in 2024 collectively across all campaigns.


Priority Roadmap for Role


  • Campaign Reporting
  • Attention Tracking & Management
  • Premium Video


About You


  • 3-6 years of analytics, performance reporting and strategy
  • Comfortable writing insights and developing points of views to develop meaningful learning agendas that push the business forward
  • Passion for digital marketing and emerging trends in the digital landscape
  • Experience communicating with internal and external stakeholders at a variety of levels
  • Fluency with Excel (including pivot tables and vlookups)
  • Comfortable in a fast-paced and deadline-driven environment
  • Deep knowledge of and experience working with major ad-tech / mar-tech stacks (e.g. Google, Adobe, Amazon, Facebook, Oracle, SFDC), inclusive of DSPs, ad servers, web analytics platforms, DCO and CRM


The Essentials


  • Innovative and growth-oriented mindset
  • Strong business acumen and critical thinking skills
  • Strong aptitude for creative problem solving & solution structuring, able to distill complex information sets into clear insights, gaps, and paths forward for clients
  • Ability to analyze large, complex data sets and synthesize results
  • Ability to develop custom frameworks & utilize existing team frameworks to identify, prioritize, structure and solve complex client problems
  • Strong executive presence with experience telling concise executive-level stories
  • Highly capable in orchestrating cross-functional engagements involving multiple internal teams & capabilities across our diverse network of marketing & technology professionals
  • An aptitude & motivation for continuous learning & innovation as our business landscape rapidly evolves


Not a Must, But a Plus


  • Experience with data analysis tools such as SQL or Tableau


At Media.Monks, we believe in fostering an environment where a diversity of perspectives can thrive. We proactively work to design hiring processes that promote equity and inclusion while mitigating bias. We celebrate diversity and are committed to building a team that reflects the communities we serve. We welcome and encourage qualified applicants, from all backgrounds, who are excited to contribute to our mission.

Benefits

What We Offer


  • Excellent, full coverage medical, dental, and vision insurance with employer-paid HRA
  • Generous PTO and 15 company-wide holidays
  • 401k with company contribution
  • Paid parental leave
  • Work-life balance with an emphasis on personal well-being
  • Career growth in a disruptor space & entrepreneurial opportunities within the Media.Monks network
  • A globally diverse & inclusive culture with employee resource groups such as S4 Melanin, Pride.Monks, Cultura.Monks, and more!
  • Authentic commitment to DEI efforts and sustainable growth. (Why Sir Martin Sorrell signed The Climate Pledge here!)


Media.Monks has provided a compensation range that represents its good faith estimate of what Media.Monks may pay for the position at the time of posting. Media.Monks may ultimately pay more or less than the posted compensation range. The salary offered to the selected candidate will be determined based on job-related factors, but not based on a candidate’s sex or any other protected status.

Salary Range$125,000—$140,000 USD

About Monks

Monks is the global, purely digital, unitary operating brand of S4Capital plc. With a legacy of innovation and specialized expertise, Monks combines an extraordinary range of global marketing and technology services to accelerate business possibilities and redefine how brands and businesses interact with the world. Its integration of systems and workflows delivers unfettered content production, scaled experiences, enterprise-grade technology and data science fueled by AI—managed by the industry’s best and most diverse digital talent—to help the world’s trailblazing companies outmaneuver and outpace their competition.

Monks was named a Contender in The Forrester Wave™: Global Marketing Services. It has remained a constant presence on Adweek’s Fastest Growing lists (2019-23), ranks among Cannes Lions' Top 10 Creative Companies (2022-23) and is the only partner to have been placed in AdExchanger’s Programmatic Power Players list every year (2020-24). In addition to being named Adweek’s first AI Agency of the Year (2023), Monks has been recognized by Business Intelligence in its 2024 Excellence in Artificial Intelligence Awards program in three categories: the Individual category, Organizational Winner in AI Strategic Planning and AI Product for its service Monks.Flow. Monks has also garnered the title of Webby Production Company of the Year (2021-24), won a record number of FWAs and has earned a spot on Newsweek’s Top 100 Global Most Loved Workplaces 2023.

We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to building a respectful and empowering work environment for all people to freely express themselves amongst colleagues who embrace diversity in all respects. Including fresh voices and unique points of view in all aspects of our business not only creates an environment where we can all grow and thrive but also increases our potential to produce work that better represents—and resonates with—the world around us.

While we continue to grow our teams, please be mindful of fraudulent job postings and recruiting activities that may use our company name and information. Please be mindful to protect your personal information, especially your national identification number, and bank account information during a recruiting process. While Monks may reach out to potential candidates via LinkedIn, we will always ask applicants to apply through our website (https://monks.com/careers) and will never ask for payment or bank account information during the recruitment process.
